intro: Sedum gypsicola subsp. truwcriae, commonly known as the gypsum sedum, is a succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its fleshy, often blue-green leaves that are adapted to store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils, particularly in environments with high levels of gypsum. This subspecies is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in dry, sunny habitats.
